  40. ‌#define ngx_string(str)     { sizeof(str) - 1, (u_char *) str }
  41. ‌#define ngx_null_string     { 0, NULL }
  42. ‌#define ngx_str_set(str, text)                                               \
  43.     (str)->len = sizeof(text) - 1; (str)->data = (u_char *) text
  44. ‌#define ngx_str_null(str)   (str)->len = 0; (str)->data = NULL


  47. ‌#define ngx_tolower(c)      (u_char) ((c >= 'A' && c <= 'Z') ? (c | 0x20) : c)
  48. ‌#define ngx_toupper(c)      (u_char) ((c >= 'a' && c <= 'z') ? (c & ~0x20) : c)

  50. void ngx_strlow(u_char *dst, u_char *src, size_t n);

  56. /* msvc and icc7 compile strcmp() to inline loop */
  57. ‌#define ngx_strcmp(s1, s2)  strcmp((const char *) s1, (const char *) s2)


  60. ‌#define ngx_strstr(s1, s2)  strstr((const char *) s1, (const char *) s2)

  63. ‌#define ngx_strchr(s1, c)   strchr((const char *) s1, (int) c)

  65. static ngx_inline u_char *
  66. ‌ngx_strlchr(u_char *p, u_char *last, u_char c)
  67. {
  68.     while (p < last) {

  70.         if (*p == c) {
  71.             return p;
  72.         }

  74.         p++;
  75.     }

  77.     return NULL;
  78. }


  81. /*
  82. * msvc and icc7 compile memset() to the inline "rep stos"
  83. * while ZeroMemory() and bzero() are the calls.
  84. * icc7 may also inline several mov's of a zeroed register for small blocks.
  85. */
  86. ‌#define ngx_memzero(buf, n)       (void) memset(buf, 0, n)
  87. ‌#define ngx_memset(buf, c, n)     (void) memset(buf, c, n)


  90. #if (NGX_MEMCPY_LIMIT)

  92. void *ngx_memcpy(void *dst, const void *src, size_t n);
  93. ‌#define ngx_cpymem(dst, src, n)   (((u_char *) ngx_memcpy(dst, src, n)) + (n))

  95. #else

  97. /*
  98. * gcc3, msvc, and icc7 compile memcpy() to the inline "rep movs".
  99. * gcc3 compiles memcpy(d, s, 4) to the inline "mov"es.
  100. * icc8 compile memcpy(d, s, 4) to the inline "mov"es or XMM moves.
  101. */
  102. ‌#define ngx_memcpy(dst, src, n)   (void) memcpy(dst, src, n)
  103. ‌#define ngx_cpymem(dst, src, n)   (((u_char *) memcpy(dst, src, n)) + (n))

  105. #endif


  108. #if ( __INTEL_COMPILER >= 800 )

  110. /*
  111. * the simple inline cycle copies the variable length strings up to 16
  112. * bytes faster than icc8 autodetecting _intel_fast_memcpy()
  113. */

  115. static ngx_inline u_char *
  116. ‌ngx_copy(u_char *dst, u_char *src, size_t len)
  117. {
  118.     if (len < 17) {

  120.         while (len) {
  121.             *dst++ = *src++;
  122.             len--;
  123.         }

  125.         return dst;

  127.     } else {
  128.         return ngx_cpymem(dst, src, len);
  129.     }
  130. }

  132. #else

  134. ‌#define ngx_copy                  ngx_cpymem

  136. #endif


  139. ‌#define ngx_memmove(dst, src, n)   (void) memmove(dst, src, n)
  140. ‌#define ngx_movemem(dst, src, n)   (((u_char *) memmove(dst, src, n)) + (n))

  144. ‌#define ngx_memcmp(s1, s2, n)  memcmp((const char *) s1, (const char *) s2, n)
